Text.Value: My favourite in all of the Coast. All of Faer√ªn, even. Not even the Sea of Stars could rival its magnificence -
It's funny.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches Wyll. He is contemplative.

Text.Value: It is. I swear, I've lived a thousand lives since I've known you.
How is this a question? The answer is Mizora. It's always been Mizora.
I deserve that. And I'm sorry.
I've lived at the mercy of fiends - a devil's plaything trying to right the Coast's wrong.
It builds mountains and deserts, only to tear them asunder. It fells armies, it conquers kings, queens - even gods.
*Your stomach falls briefly as the acorn touches your hand. You shiver with melancholy - and hope.*
Ignore his favour.
Sit with me. It's time we started our happily-ever-after.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Karlach sits next to Wyll, an intimate but safe distance. They talk all night.

Text.Value: But time caught up with me. Father is dead. Baldur's Gate nears its ruin. My one and only duty must be to the city.
Understood. Your will is strong, and I would have it no other way.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wyll withdraws his hand

Text.Value: We blink, and we're gone. And our hopes, our memories, our heart-bonds are gone with us.
I was thinking - how about one last dance. For old times' sake?
And who I want at my side as it passes.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The camera moves from the two of you and outwards. A vista of stunning and quiet beauty.
EditorData.logicalname: Cinematic Wyll + Player Hand In Hand

Text.Value: Eternity will yield to Lady Shar's darkness, eventually. If you are content to share me with her... I accept.
Sometimes I feel like I never had a yesterday. But that doesn't mean I can't have a tomorrow. Yes, I am yours.
Yes, yes, yes!
For old times' sake.
A beautiful story. I'm glad you told it to me.
I did. But also to see something else:
Get down here, already. It's time we started our happily-ever-after!
But I've only now come to see who my true enemy's been.
I'm not sure I can see into forever. But it's still a nice view.
Come, let me show you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player takes the acorn from Wyll's hands. He smiles, but remains kneeling.

Text.Value: Time is so gods-damned greedy. It can never give, only take. My eternal soul is at its mercy.
If just for a moment.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Wyll reaches out his hand in front of him, to the player, at the end of the line.

Text.Value: Gods. You've made me the happiest soul in all the Realms.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wyll walks away, leaving the player standing there. The camera pans up, then the scene fades.

Text.Value: The poignant tedium of your story?
Maybe. But I think the right answer is much simpler than that:
For now, let's enjoy this piece of eternity.
A toll of the bell - it's all I ask. Our problems can wait that long.
I was hoping you'd think so.
Go on - I'll follow.
I understand, truly. All I need is you. The rest is just details.
Lady Shar will appreciate the wickedness, at least. Let's see the snake this devil's been hiding.
Shit, yes. Let's see the snake this devil's been hiding.
Time.
Not yet, Wyll. Not 'til all this trouble is behind us.
It even comes for your people in the astral sea. Time may hunt slowly - but it still hunts.
I cannot promise you eternity - I belong to Lady Shar. But even she will not begrudge me tonight, if you wish...
I can't give you forever, Wyll. But I can give you tonight.
I can't take your hand without hurting you, but I'll follow where you lead.
Smile and take Wyll's hand.
The dragon lords sparking the skies above it. The moon elves first plucking the strings of the Weave.
I'll leave you to your thoughts. I hope somewhere in them, you find peace.
I'd like to think not. The answer is much simpler than that:
All this time, and that's still what you see?

EditorData.stateContext: Wyll kneeling holds the acorn out fully towards the player

Text.Value: But - I can't resist you. I'd sooner know one unforgettable night than a lifetime of 'what ifs'.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wyll casts aside the acorn and holds his hand to the player.

Text.Value: I used to come here and climb it when father's eye was turned elsewhere - daydream of the stories it might tell, if I listened close enough.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wyll, still kneeling, pulls the player to the ground and they start kissing intensely.
EditorData.logicalname: Cinematic Wyll Pulls Short Player towards him

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wyll, still kneeling, pulls the player to the ground and they start kissing intensely.
EditorData.logicalname: Cinematic Wyll Pulls Player towards him

Text.Value: You mean so much to me. I can feel my heart bleeding.
Time is so gods-damned greedy. It can never give, only take.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player takes Wyll's right hand with their left. Wyll smiles and the scene fades out.

Text.Value: So you'd think. But the right answer is much simpler than that:

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wyll walks away, leaving the player holding the acorn in their hand. The camera pans upwards showing the gorgeous night sky.
EditorData.logicalname: Cinematic Wyll Leaves, Player has Acorn

Text.Value: Pull me too close, and I'm destined to hurt you.
I love you. Will you be mine - today, and tomorrow, and reaching into eternity?
May you be granted every wish you ask for. You deserve each and every one.
Get down here, already. It's time we started our happily-ever-after!
I'm not sure I can promise eternity - Lady Shar demands fealty... this is a lot to take in.
I'm not sure I can promise you that much. After Shar, I need to live my own life. This is a lot to take in...
I'm not sure. It's a lot to take in.
Standing here, I feel like I can see into forever.
My mother always said the Wilden Oak's acorns held just a touch of wishing magic.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Wyll and the player bow to each other, and then slowly begin to dance. This one is sadder than before. The camer pans upwards as the dance continues, and the scene fades away.

JLatino: Reuse dance anims, slow them down, fade to black as dance starts

The scene fades back in. Wyll and the player are near the Chionthar, and walk towards a towering and impressive tree. Acorns are scattered underneath it. It is a beautiful night; the moon and stars shine bright.

Text.Value: Smile and take Wyll's hand.
You break up with me and then ask to dance? That's some godsdamned nerve.
The Wilden Oak. Legend has it it's stood since the Age of Dawn.
I don't want a commitment. But I'd welcome a good roll in the hay.

EditorData.stateContext: Wyll holds out his right hand in front of him, to the player, wanting it to be taken.

Text.Value: The elder brain?
We've got big problems to solve, Wyll. Maybe later.
Lucky for us, I've found a way to stop it -
But do me one favour:

EditorData.stateContext: Wyll kneeling holding an acorn in the palm of his hands.

Text.Value: Seriously? You dragged me out here to look at a tree?
I used to come here and climb it when father's eye was turned elsewhere - daydream of the stories it might tell, if I listened close enough.
Not so long ago, I was dreaming of our own personal forever, endless nights in each other's arms.
Me too.
Sorry, but a 'no' will have to do.
Maybe I can staunch it. Just - for a moment.
The archdevil Zariel?
Ours is such a beautiful story, and this isn't the ending I wanted to write.
Join Wyll in the grass. Give yourself to him completely.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wyll pulls the player to the ground. They sit, holding hands, as the camera pans up, showing the beautiful landscape ahead of our lovers.

Text.Value: You, yourself?
At least - take this.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Wyll hands you the acorn at the end of the line.

Text.Value: And none of it shall go to waste, you have my solemn promise. But - truth be told, it's not just Baldur's Gate I'm protecting.
Dance. Remember your precious moment with Wyll.
If that be so, then may my greatest wish come true tonight:

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) At the end of the line, Wyll holds his hands out to you, with the acorn held in them.

Text.Value: I've been thinking a lot about forever. Moreso, I've been thinking everything that comes before -
I live at the mercy of fiends. A devil's plaything awaiting a future in the Hells.
The Wilden Oak. Legend has it it's stood since the Age of Dawn.
All right. But this better be worth it.
I understand. The city needs you, and I'd only be getting in the way.
Enjoy the view. Enjoy Wyll's quiet company.
So this is a break-up? I should've known, after all I've given you.
I live at the mercy of fiends. A man with the horrid face of a devil, awaiting his future in Hells' blistered army.
I don't want a commitment. But I'd welcome a good roll in the hay.
*Your skin flushes and your soul sings as you palm the acorn. Wishing magic, affection, love - whatever the cause, it's as real as the ground beneath you.*
One monster slain, then. And another after that, and then another. There will always be one more evil to fell.
I - I understand. All the more fool am I for pressing my fortunes.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Wyll stands up at end of the line, still holding the acorn.

Text.Value: It's about time. Let's see what the Blade can do with his weapon.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The camera moves upwards, showing the player from above, then fades away.

Text.Value: Oh gods, no. You've got the wrong idea about all this.
Lady Shar may not approve of such a commitment... but you can make it up to her, surely. Take the acorn.
Take the acorn and nod.
As the Blade, I've faced untold brutes and beasts. Together we've seen illithid horrors most souls could merely fathom.
Nor could it rival yours.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wyll kneels to the ground. He takes an acorn and holds it in the palm of his hands, but keeps them close to his body.
EditorData.logicalname: Cinematic Wyll Kneels and Picks up Acorn

Text.Value: Standing here, I feel like I can see into forever.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: They roll about under the tree as the camera pans upwards, showing the beautiful night once more, as the happy couple begin to make love under the comfort of the Wilding Oak. (Use all the cinematic discretion you like!) The scene then fades away.

Text.Value: Time is so godsdamned greedy. It races forward no matter how hard we rail against it.
My father taught me more lessons than I can count. But perhaps the greatest one is this: a champion's heart's as sharp as a new blade.
Me.

EditorData.stateContext: Wyll is kneeling, his hands no longer holding the acorn.

Text.Value: Dance. And when you do, think of me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wyll turns and walks away, leaving you alone.

The scene fades back in. Wyll and the player are near the Chionthar, and walk towards a towering and impressive tree. Acorns are scattered underneath it. It is a beautiful night; the moon and stars shine bright. NOTE: Karlach CANNOT take Wyll's hand, they shouldn't be touching.See N41
EditorData.logicalname: Cinematic Wyll + Player Walk (NO HAND HOLDING)

Text.Value: Forever could only be a dream.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player walks away. The camera shows Wyll standing there. He closes his eyes and the scene fades.

Wyll and the player bow to each other, and then slowly begin to dance. This one is sadder than before. The camer pans upwards as the dance continues, and the scene fades away.

Short player branch

JLatino: Reuse dance anims, slow them down, fade to black as dance starts
EditorData.logicalname: Cinematic Wyll + Short Player Sad Dance

Text.Value: Gods, I want you. But I can't take your body without taking your heart.
Friends, then. I'd like that.
It is. I promise.
Quite the opposite. I'd be getting in yours.
All right. But this better be worth it.
We can still have it, Wyll. We can defeat the Brain and be together.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: They roll about under the tree as the camera pans upwards, showing the beautiful night once more, as the happy couple begin to make love under the comfort of the Wilding Oak. (Use all the cinematic discretion you like!) The scene then fades away.
The player dances, mimicking the moves Wyll made in the second romance night. The scene fades.

Text.Value: Lucky for us, I've found a way to stop time -
Gods, no. Have you looked at yourself? You're hideous.
The dragon lords sparking the skies above it. The moon elves first plucking the strings of the Weave.
I can't. I'm sorry, Wyll.
I couldn't have said it better. Let's go.
Leave without a word.
Walk away without a word.
But I'm ready to live a thousand more, if you can bear me.
One last dance, for old times' sake.
I am Lady Shar's - she will always come first. But if you are content to share me with her... I accept.
Bear you? My life didn't start until we met. Of course I want to be with you.
Yes. I want to be with you, for as long as you'll have me.

Synopsis: Wyll's Romance scene in Act 3. Wyll invited the player to a romantic talk near the banks fo the chionthar.
